adHeader: AP Chemistry Biology English Math Tutor
adDetails: Lots of expertise and experience!! Your scholastic success is the goal! Professional biochemist and CA State credentialed teacher enjoys working with teens to adults to make science and English "real," understandable, and approachable. Local or online rate is $40/hr. Nominal travel fee charged for my traveling out of area. Advanced services offered at same basic rate, such as multiple students, English language learners, reading development, presentation skills, career guidance, college applications and test preparation (SAT, ACT, AP, GRE, CBEST). Inquire about sliding-scale rates for low-income. Providing personalized tutoring or private teaching, including lesson plans, curriculum, and home schooling support. References available. Please email for more information. Degrees PhD 2002 Biochemistry & Molecular Biology, University of California, Los Angeles BS 1991 Chemistry, California State University East Bay Credentials Cred. 2008 California State Teaching Credential: Science Intern, Short-Term Staffing, and 30-Day Cert. 1992 Biotechnology, California State University East Bay Professional Positions and Activities 2009-present Independent Biochemistry Research and Education Professional 2006-2009 Chemistry and Biology Teacher, and Adjunct Professor, Depts of Chemistry and Biology CSUEB Taught high school Advanced Placement (AP) Chemistry, College Prep. (CP) Biology, and English Language Learner (ELL) Science. Conducted university courses in freshman-level Intro. to Molecular & Cellular Biology and senior-level/graduate General Biochemistry. 2003-2007 Chemist, Physical Biosciences Division, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab (LBNL) Engineering, synthesis, purification, and characterization of protein-protein and protein-oligonucleotide complexes involving bacterial transcription. Complex optimization and data collection for 3D structure determination by nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and crystallography. Complex biophysical characterization by chromatography, gel electrophoresis, dynamic light scattering, mass spectrometry, analytical ultracentrifugation, enzymology, NMR, X-ray diffraction, and 3-D computer modeling. Grant proposal preparation, graduate student training, interdisciplinary collaboration, data publication and presentations locally and internationally. 2002-2003 Postdoctoral Fellow, Molecular Biology Institute, University California Los Angeles Awarded National Institutes of Health (NIH) postdoctoral fellowship in bacterial pathogenesis, completed and published crystallographic project involving target DNA complexes with bacterial transcription factors, trained graduate students, computational and biochemical research. 1994-2002 Graduate Student Researcher, Dept. Chemistry & Biochemistry, UC Los Angeles Macromolecular crystallography and biophysical characterization of DNA and protein complexes. Solved first protein/DNA complex structure of its type during thesis research, published, lectured nationally and internationally, supervised technicians, trained graduate students, led collaborations between pharmacology and biochemistry, solid-state nucleotide synthesis, chromatography, spectrometry, crystallography. 1993-1994 Research Assistant, New Product Development, Collagen Corporation, Palo Alto, CA Developed biosynthetic ophthalmic implant, biomaterial synthesis, protein modification, conjugation, enzymatic and chromatographic analyses, authored internal research reports, research lectures, and four invention records.
